name: Day & Night System
description: Adds a day and night system in the GD menus!

start-sunrise-hr.name: Start Sunrise Hr
start-sunrise-hr.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

start-sunrise-min.name: Start Sunrise Min
start-sunrise-min.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

end-sunrise-hr.name: End Sunrise Hr
end-sunrise-hr.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

end-sunrise-min.name: End Sunrise Min
end-sunrise-min.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

start-sunset-hr.name: Start Sunset Hr
start-sunset-hr.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

start-sunset-min.name: Start Sunset Min
start-sunset-min.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

end-sunset-hr.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

end-sunset-min.name: End Sunset Min
end-sunset-min.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

start-night-hr.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

start-night-min.name: Start Night Min
start-night-min.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

end-night-hr.name: End Night Hr
end-night-hr.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

end-night-min.name: End Night Min
end-night-min.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

start-dark-hr.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

start-dark-min.name: Start Dark Min
start-dark-min.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

end-dark-hr.name: End Dark Hr
end-dark-hr.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

end-dark-min.name: End Dark Min
end-dark-min.description: Keep in mind this uses military time. Example: 1pm = 13 <cr>Do not override the values with other events! Example: Sunset 7pm-8pm, Night 6pm-8pm</c>

enable-sunrise.name: Sunrise Event
enable-sunrise.description: Enable/Disable the sunrise event. (Disabling this will just be normal GD)

enable-sunset.name: Sunset Event
enable-sunset.description: Enable/Disable the sunset event. (Disabling this will just be normal GD)

enable-night.name: Night Event
enable-night.description: Enable/Disable the night event. (Disabling this will just be normal GD)

enable-dark.name: Dark Event
enable-dark.description: Enable/Disable the dark event. (Disabling this will just be normal GD)

enable-dark-overlay-night.name: Dark Overlay In Night Event
enable-dark-overlay-night.description: Enable/Disable the dark overlay during the night event.

enable-dark-overlay-dark.name: Dark Overlay In Dark Event
enable-dark-overlay-dark.description: Enable/Disable the dark overlay during the dark event.
